metadata.Title: CVE-2021-40491 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ftp client in GNU Inetutils before 2.2 does not validate addresses returned by PASV/LSPV responses to make sure they match the server address. This is similar to CVE-2020-8284 for curl.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-ping - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-talk - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-tools - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: inetutils package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
